content:
I tried to figure out what I could do to let views in Backdrop catch up with D7. But that's such a huge task that I don't even know where to start.

We have this daunting meta issue. But in the meantime there are two more views releases for D7:

  • https://www.drupal.org/project/views/releases/7.x-3.24-rc1
  • https://www.drupal.org/project/views/releases/7.x-3.24

How can we ever catch up? Or if we're not able to: how can we avoid to fall behind even more?

crossport views commits from 7.x-3.22 - 7.x-3.23 路 Issue #3853 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
Has separate issues/PRs: #4075 | e19e3546 | Issue #2900405 by collinhaines, jenlampton, sano, paulbeaney, jyraya: Undefined index in views_handler_filter->store_exposed_input(). #4075 | ddaeddc3...
And that we always have to keep an eye on the regressions introduced by previous releases doesn't make it easier. Triage alone would take a long time. Fixing and reviewing... oh dear.

How about a spike to triage them?

(I volunteer to take a crack at this one :smile: https://www.drupal.org/node/3097632 )

@indigoxela we have a decent process for managing releases of Drupal core / contrib -- not great because we obviously aren't doing a good job of keeping up, but the create/review process is actually less work than it seems.
We can do many of the commits from a Drupal project in a single PR for core (which is different than our usual process of one commit per PR)
